thread.title: Matt Damon Recreates Famous Movie Roles on 'Late Late Show with James Corden'
thread.title_full: Matt Damon Recreates Famous Movie Roles on 'Late Late Show with James Corden'

author: AceShowbiz.com
title: Matt Damon Recreates Famous Movie Roles on 'Late Late Show with James Corden'
text:
Comments Damon and Corden used low-budget props and had quick costume changes to recreate the actor's famous roles from the past two decades. 
Stopping by " The Late Late Show with James Corden ", Matt Damon recreated his famous movie roles with the help of host James Corden . He among others recreated the memorable moments from "Good Will Hunting", "Saving Private Ryan", " The Bourne Identity ", "The Talented Mr. Ripley", and many more films. For the take, which Corden titled "Role Call," the duo used low-budget props and had quick costume changes, quoting famous dialogue from the past two decades of Damon's notable roles. They, in one scene, put on shrimp outfits for " Happy Feet Two ", for which Damon provided his voice. Damon also came out in a spacesuit for his upcoming movie, " The Martian ", but rather than doing a line or two from the film, he just promoted the movie, noting it "opens everywhere." That was not the first time Corden did the so-called "Role Call" take. The host previously reenacted iconic moments with Tom Hanks and Arnold Schwarzenegger from their films.
